3: I've never heard of a Corrupted doing pranks before. Liv, can you check its original model?
...Based on its shape and size, it is likely the painting model 'Spray Can', also named Nozzle, from Cosmos Industries back in the middle Golden Age.
It was mainly used to paint large areas, but some models were used in performances, education, and artistic creations...
So that's why it's been going around 'creating' and insisting that its work is 'art'...
But can mechs really undertake artistic endeavors?
Even I'm not sure. In Babylonia, art made by mechs are under the strict supervision and guidance of humans.
If you leave them alone, then you'll get these strange drawings indecipherable to humans. Like these graffiti.
Mechs have always gone on well with humans in other areas, but when it comes to art...
Commandant, can you understand these drawings?

2: I understand some bits, I think...
4: Nope, I'm lost like you guys.

3: Commandant, if you'd sounded a little bit more sincere, I just might have believed.
Thankfully, this means you're still normal...
Liv, now's not the time for this. Whether this paint can's been making art out of its own will or not—
It has destroyed a lot of Constructs, which means it's our enemy.
As for its artistic mystery, I think the answer can only be found after we catch up with it.
But we've already lost track of it. Not to mention being in this magnetically disruptive mist.
Not an issue. Our radars might not work, but we still have its trail... Look at the marks on the floor.
